common.desc: This project covers all main concepts from official docs.
common.check_sidebar: Please check the sidebar for demos.

conditional.title: Conditional Rendering
conditional.always_in_dom: âœ¨ These details are always in DOM!

events.title: Event Handling
events.log_placeholder: Interact with buttons above to see logs...

lifecycle.title: Lifecycle Hooks
lifecycle.hint: Clicking increment triggers DOM update, firing onUpdated hook.
lifecycle.mounted_msg: ðŸŸ¢ onMounted called: Component is mounted.
lifecycle.updated_msg: ðŸ”µ onUpdated called: Component DOM updated.

watchers.title: Watchers
watchers.default_answer: Questions usually contain a question mark. ;-)
watchers.error_api: Error! Could not reach the API.
watchers.log_msg: Side effect: Count is {count}, Double is {double}

template_refs.title: Template Refs
template_refs.focus_desc: This input is focused on mount via ref:
template_refs.input_placeholder: I will be focused on mount

component_basics.title: Component Basics
component_basics.desc: Here is a child component used 3 times:
component_basics.state_desc: Each component maintains its own state.

registration.title: Component Registration
registration.global_desc: Components registered globally can be used in the template of any component within the application.
registration.local_desc: Components registered locally are only available in the component where they are registered.
registration.local_hint: In <script setup>, imported components are locally registered automatically!

component_events.title: Component Events
component_events.click_hint: Click buttons in children to emit events:

vmodel.title: v-model Demo
vmodel.vue3_note: In Vue 3, v-model defaults to using modelValue prop and update:modelValue event.

attrs.title: Fallthrough Attributes
attrs.desc: The button below receives class="large-btn" and @click handler from the parent, even though they are not defined as props.
attrs.note: Inspect the button element to see the applied class.

async.title: Async Components
async.desc: Click the button to load the component asynchronously. It has a 2-second artificial delay to show the loading state.

composables.title: Composables
composables.desc: Move your mouse around to see the coordinates update. This logic is reused via the useMouse composable.

directives.title: Custom Directives
directives.focus_desc: The input below is automatically focused on page load.
directives.color_green: This text is colored Green (#42b883) by a directive.
directives.color_blue: This text is colored Blue (#35495e) by a directive.
directives.color_red: This text is colored Red (#ff6b6b) by a directive.

plugins.title: Plugins
plugins.desc: Plugins are self-contained code that usually add global-level functionality to Vue.
plugins.example_info: Example: vue-i18n plugin provides global $t function or useI18n composable.

keep_alive.title: KeepAlive Demo
keep_alive.hint: Switch between components. Type something in the input, then switch away and back. Notice the state is preserved!

suspense.title: Suspense Demo
suspense.desc: Suspense handles async dependencies in the component tree. Reload the component to see the loading state again.

teleport.title: Teleport Demo
teleport.desc: Clicking the button will render the modal as a direct child of <body>, breaking out of the component's DOM hierarchy.
teleport.modal_content: My parent component is deep in the DOM tree, but I am rendered directly under body.

pinia.title: Pinia State Management
pinia.intro: This is a counter example using Pinia for state management.
pinia.persistence_hint: Try switching to other pages and coming back, you'll see the state is preserved (unless you refresh the page).
